Code functions in detailsÔÉÅ

Method functionsÔÉÅ

@author: Morgane T. and Ozan O.

Script of methods that we can apply to CTD and WP lists Adapted from overlapAnalysis.py from Ozan O. (Paper vitamin A)

odamnet.methods_functions.overlap(targetGeneSet, pathOfInterestGenesDict, pathOfInterestNamesDict, pathwaysOfInterestList, backgroundGenesDict, featureName, outputPath, analysisName)ÔÉÅ

Calculate overlap between target genes and pathways of interest

Metrics :

  • M is the population size (Nb of genes inside WikiPathway for Homo sapiens pathways)

  • n is the number of successes in the population (Nb of genes inside the selected RD WP)

  • N is the sample size (Nb of genes shared between target list (from chemical) and background genes from WP)

  • x is the number of drawn ‚Äúsuccesses‚Äù (Nb of genes shared between target list and RD WP)

Parameters:

  • targetGeneSet (set) ‚Äì Set of HGNC targets

  • pathOfInterestGenesDict (dict) ‚Äì Dictionary of pathways of interest

  • pathOfInterestNamesDict (dict) ‚Äì Dictionary of WP composed of title of them

  • pathwaysOfInterestList (set) ‚Äì Pathways of interest list and their associated background name

  • backgroundGenesDict (set) ‚Äì Dict of background genes

  • featureName (str) ‚Äì Feature name (g.e. MeSH ID or chemical name etc.)

  • outputPath (str) ‚Äì Folder path to save the results

  • analysisName (str) ‚Äì Analysis name for the output name file

odamnet.methods_functions.overlapAnalysis(targetGenesDict, pathOfInterestGenesDict, pathOfInterestNamesDict, pathwaysOfInterestList, backgroundGenesDict, outputPath, analysisName)ÔÉÅ

For each chemical given in input, calculate overlap.rst with RD WP.

Parameters:

  • targetGenesDict (dict) ‚Äì Dict composed of interaction genes list for each chemical

  • pathOfInterestGenesDict (dict) ‚Äì Dict of pathways of interest genes

  • pathOfInterestNamesDict (dict) ‚Äì Dict of pathways of interest names

  • pathwaysOfInterestList (list) ‚Äì Pathways of interest list and their associated background name

  • backgroundGenesDict (list) ‚Äì Dict of background genes

  • outputPath (str) ‚Äì Folder path to save the results

  • analysisName (str) ‚Äì Analysis name for the output name file

odamnet.methods_functions.RWR(configPath, networksPath, outputPath, sifPathName, top)ÔÉÅ

Perform a Random Walk with Restart analysis on different multiplex and networks. You have to specify seeds and networks.

Parameters:

  • configPath (str) ‚Äì Configuration file name path

  • networksPath (str) ‚Äì Networks path name

  • outputPath (str) ‚Äì Output folder path name

  • sifPathName (str) ‚Äì Result file name path to write SIF result file

  • top (int) ‚Äì Number of results to report in SIF file

odamnet.methods_functions.DOMINO(genesFileName, networkFileName, outputPath, featureName)ÔÉÅ

Run active modules identification analysis on the DOMINO server

Parameters:

  • genesFileName ‚Äì Active genes file name (g.e. list of genes of interest)

  • networkFileName ‚Äì Network file name

  • outputPath ‚Äì Output path name to save the results

  • featureName ‚Äì Feature name (g.e. chemical name)

Returns:

  • activeModulesDict (dict) ‚Äì Dict of active modules identified

odamnet.methods_functions.DOMINOandOverlapAnalysis(featuresDict, networkFileName, pathOfInterestGenesDict, pathOfInterestNamesDict, pathwaysOfInterestList, backgroundGenesDict, outputPath, analysisName)ÔÉÅ

For each genes list, run an active module identification. For each AM identified, run an overlap analysis against the pathways of interest.

Parameters:

  • featuresDict ‚Äì Dict of list of genes

  • networkFileName ‚Äì Content of network file

  • pathOfInterestGenesDict ‚Äì Genes dict of pathways of interest

  • pathOfInterestNamesDict ‚Äì Names dict of pathways of interest

  • pathwaysOfInterestList ‚Äì List of pathways of interest and their bg name associated

  • backgroundGenesDict ‚Äì Dict of background genes

  • outputPath ‚Äì Output path name to save results

  • analysisName (str) ‚Äì Analysis name for the output name file

odamnet.methods_functions.DOMINOOutput(networkFileName, AMIFileName, featureName, outputPath)ÔÉÅ
odamnet.methods_functions.createNetworkandBipartiteFiles(bipartiteName, networkName, pathOfInterestGenesDict)ÔÉÅ

Create a bipartite between genes symbols and pathways of interest Create a disconnected network between pathways of interest

Parameters:

  • bipartiteName (filename) ‚Äì Bipartite file name

  • networkName (FILENAME) ‚Äì Network file name

  • pathOfInterestGenesDict (dict) ‚Äì Dict of pathways of interest

odamnet.methods_functions.downloadNDExNetwork(networkUUID, outputFileName)ÔÉÅ

Download network from NDEx website

Parameters:

  • networkUUID (str) ‚Äì Network ID

  • outputFileName (FILENAME) ‚Äì SIF file name to write network

CTD functionsÔÉÅ

@author: Morgane T.

CTD functions

Script to manage the input genes list reading. Genes list could come from - a chemical list and requested from CTD - a CTD file (file created by request CTD) - a list of interested genes

odamnet.CTD_functions.readFeaturesFile(featuresFile)ÔÉÅ

Read a list file (composed of gene names or chemical names).

Parameters:

featuresFile (FILE) ‚Äì Content of the features file

Returns:

  • featureNamesList (list) ‚Äì List of feature names

odamnet.CTD_functions.readCTDFile(CTDFile, nbPub, outputPath)ÔÉÅ

Read CTD file, created from a request.

Parameters:

  • CTDFile (FILE) ‚Äì Content of the CTD file

  • nbPub (int) ‚Äì Minimum number of publications to keep an interaction

  • outputPath (PATH) ‚Äì Output path directory name

Returns:

  • targetGenesDict (dict) ‚Äì Dictionary of genes for each chemical as query

odamnet.CTD_functions.CTDrequest(chemName, association, outputPath, nbPub)ÔÉÅ

Function to request CTD database.

Search all genes which interact with the chemical given in input. Could be several chemicals names in the same line. Analysis will be done like if it‚Äôs only one chemical. If hierarchicalAssociations is used, chemical related to the chemical given in input are used as query. Focus on genes present in Homo sapiens.

Parameters:

  • chemName (str) ‚Äì Chemical name of MeSH ids string

  • association (str) ‚Äì Association name (hierarchicalAssociations or directAssociations)

  • outputPath (str) ‚Äì Folder path to save the results

  • nbPub (int) ‚Äì Minimum number of publications to keep an interaction

Returns:

  • homoGenesList (list) ‚Äì List of genes which interact with chemicals given in input (only Homo sapiens)

  • chemMeSH (str) ‚Äì Composition of MeSH ID from chemicals given in input

odamnet.CTD_functions.CTDrequestFromFeaturesList(chemList, association, outputPath, nbPub)ÔÉÅ

Make CTD request for each chemical present in the list given in input. Each element can be composed of one or more element. If several element, the analysis will be done like if there is only one chemical.

Parameters:

  • chemList (list) ‚Äì List of chemical to request to CTD (MeSH IDs or chemical names)

  • association (str) ‚Äì Association name (hierarchicalAssociations or directAssociations)

  • outputPath (str) ‚Äì Folder path to save the results

  • nbPub (int) ‚Äì Minimum number of publications to keep an interaction

Returns:

  • chemTargetsDict (dict) ‚Äì Dict composed of interaction genes list for each chemical

odamnet.CTD_functions.targetGenesExtraction(chemicalsFile, directAssociations, outputPath, nbPub)ÔÉÅ

Read environmental factor file Request CTD and extract target genes Save results into output file Return the gene targets list

Parameters:

  • chemicalsFile (FILE) ‚Äì Content of the chemicals file list

  • directAssociations (bool) ‚Äì Chemical only or descendants too

  • outputPath (PATH) ‚Äì Folder path name to save results

  • nbPub (int) ‚Äì Minimum number of publications to keep an interaction

Returns:

  • chemTargetsDict (dict) ‚Äì Dict composed of interaction genes list for each chemical

WP functionsÔÉÅ

@author: Morgane T.

WikiPathways functions

odamnet.WP_functions.readRequestResultsWP(WPrequestResult)ÔÉÅ

Read request from WP.

Parse and extract information from request. Extract genes, names and IDs of pathways.

Parameters:

WPrequestResult (bytes) ‚Äì Request result from WikiPathway

Returns:

  • WPgenesDict (dictionary) ‚Äì Dict of genes for each WikiPathway

  • WPnamesDict (dictionary) ‚Äì Dict of titles for each WikiPathway

odamnet.WP_functions.rareDiseasesWPrequest(outputPath)ÔÉÅ

Function requests WikiPathway database.

Search all WikiPathways related to Rare Diseases. Focus on pathways related with Homo sapiens. Write results into result file.

Parameters:

outputPath (str) ‚Äì Folder path to save the results

Returns:

  • WPgenesDict (dictionary) ‚Äì Dict of genes for each RD WikiPathway

  • WPnamesDict (dictionary) ‚Äì Dict of names for each RD WikiPathway

  • pathwayOfInterestList (list) ‚Äì Pathway names list

odamnet.WP_functions.allHumanGenesFromWP(outputPath)ÔÉÅ

Extract all gene HGNC ID from Homo sapiens WP. Write request result into output file.

Parameters:

outputPath (str) ‚Äì Folder path to save the results

Returns:

  • backgroundsDict (dict) ‚Äì Dict of all human genes from WP

odamnet.WP_functions.readGMTFile(GMTFile)ÔÉÅ

Parse and extract information from GMT file.

Parameters:

GMTFile (FILE) ‚Äì Content of GMT file

Returns:

  • pathOfInterestGenesDict (dict) ‚Äì Dict of genes for each pathway of interest

  • pathOfInterestNamesDict (dict) ‚Äì Dict of names for each pathway of interest

  • pathwaysOfInterestList (list) ‚Äì Pathway names list

odamnet.WP_functions.readBackgroundsFile(backgroundsFile)ÔÉÅ

Read a backgrounds file Each line contains a background file name source correspondant of each pathway of interest The order of sources depends on the order of pathways of interest.

Parameters:

backgroundsFile (filename) ‚Äì File name of the background source of each pathway of interest

Returns:

  • backgroundsDict (dict) ‚Äì Dictionary of the background genes from different sources

  • backgroundsList (list) ‚Äì List of the background gene sources to use
